post_card.name: CHIA-CHENG CHANG
post_card.school: Graduation College and department: Yuntech, IM
post_card.content: My professional skills include website development, API construction, Chrome Extension development, web crawler, and integration with AI models.

photo_dataList.title: 85 Sky Tower
photo_dataList.subtitle: Lingya, Kaohsiung
photo_dataList.guide: The Kaohsiung 85 Sky Tower, located in Lingya District, Kaohsiung City, is adjacent to Kaohsiung Port and Shin Kong Mitsukoshi Pier. It is a skyscraper that stands 85 stories tall, currently the tallest building in Kaohsiung and the second tallest in Taiwan.

photo_dataList.title: Forget Worry Valley
photo_dataList.subtitle: Waipu, Taichung
photo_dataList.guide: The Wuling Farm in Waipu, Taichung, is renowned for its vast rice paddies and beautiful scenery. From June to November each year, it always attracts many tourists who come to photograph the entire golden rice field landscape.

skill_dataList.name: Front-end
skill_dataList.content: I specialize in Vue.js framework development and utilize Scss and eslint to ensure high-quality code. Additionally, I have experience with React.js, Next.js, and Bootstrap development, enabling me to quickly develop SPA architecture websites.

skill_dataList.name: Back-end
skill_dataList.content: I am proficient in programming languages ​​​​such as Python, Node.js and Java. I am good at developing APIs using frameworks such as FAST API and Express. My database has used MySQL, MongoDB and Amazon S3 to access data.

skill_dataList.name: AI
skill_dataList.content: I have experience with various models such as YOLO, Unet, Stable Diffusion, CLIP, and different large-scale language models. These experiences have enriched my AI knowledge and deepened my understanding of machine learning and deep learning.

skill_dataList.name: Other
skill_dataList.content: In DevOps applications, I use Docker to package projects and deploy them to cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform and Heroku. In addition, I have developed a Chrome Extension to crawl the data required for AI training.

projectContent.post_title: to Determine the Correct Position of the Endotracheal Tube

description.sub_title: This project improves the traditional method of doctors visually inspecting X-ray images to determine the appropriate position of an endotracheal tube, using a model-assisted approach. It can be divided into 4 main steps.

steps_wrapper.content: Using U-net to analyze chest X-ray images and segment the endotracheal tube and tracheal bifurcation.
Locating the end points of the tube and tracheal bifurcation.
Using the identified points to determine if the endotracheal tube is positioned correctly within the trachea.
Ensemble the results obtained from various U-net variant models to improve model accuracy.
